original_title: Tackle Busters at Mexico's Guadalupe Island
overview: Journey to fish-rich Guadalupe Island, 170 miles off of Northern Baja, where this remote, rugged island creates its own weather patterns seen from space. During summer, it is a breeding ground to the largest congregation of great white sharks in the Pacific and they will command a share of your fish, but from November to May, the shark-free waters offer epic tuna and “mossback” yellowtail fishing.
title: Tackle Busters at Mexico's Guadalupe Island
